To simplify further, multiply both numerator and denominator by the conjugate of the denominator: \[ w=\frac{(4+3i)(12-5i)}{(12+5i)(12-5i)}=\frac{48-20i+36i-15}{12^2-(5i)^2}=-\frac{-4}{\underbrace{144}_{a}+\underbrace{-25}_{b}} \] Thus, $$\begin{aligned} |w| &=\left|\frac{-4}{144 - (-25)}\right| \\&= \frac{4}{\underbrace{169}_{c}}\end{aligned}$$ And since absolute value does not include negative signs,\[ |w| =\frac{\underbrace{4}_{\text{positive}}} {\underbrace{169}_{d}} = \frac{4 }{169}\] The decimal form\[\frac{4 }{169}\approx .0236\]is also acceptable when calculating modulus.\quad \(\square\)
